revised_title: Biomorphology of Solomon Islands Shores and Zoning Patterns
tldr: This article discusses the biomorphology of Solomon Islands shores and the need for a new ecological classification system to account for the complexity and variety of tropical shores. The authors explore the tripartite zonation pattern and its application to different types of shores, emphasizing the importance of precision in describing dynamic and causal relationships in marine ecosystems.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Ecology
